intro: Buchozia japonica, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
